blogData.title: How To Import And Edit SRT File To Adobe Premiere Pro
blogData.description: This post will talk about what an SRT is, different ways to create an SRT file, how to import and edit an SRT file to Adobe Premiere Pro, and how to export video subtitles in Adobe Premiere Pro.
blogData.keywords: premiere pro subtitle, make subtitle in premiere pro, export file with srt, srt file generator, how to add subtitles in adobe premiere pro 2020, premiere pro open captions, premiere pro open captions not showing, How do I edit a SRT file in Premiere Pro?, How do I import a SRT file into Premiere Pro?, make srt mac, texteditor srt, premiere pro subtitle, premiere pro, adobe premiere pro, srt subtitle, srt file format, generate srt file from video, How To Create An SRT File?, what is srt file, what do you mean by srt, What is srt
blogData.coverAlt: How To Import And Edit SRT File To Adobe Premiere Pro

data.richContent:
Hello, fam!

Welcome back again to VideoTranslator support where we will be telling you the tips and tricks regarding the media and translation world.

This time, we will be explaining how you can import and edit SRT files to Adobe Premiere Pro.

Before we begin, let’s explain what an SRT file is first…

What Is SRT?

SRT is a plain-text file that contains critical information regarding subtitles, including the start and end timecodes of your text to ensure your subtitles match your audio, and the sequential number of subtitles.

By having an SRT, your video will have subtitles or captions. Having subtitles or captions on your video will be very helpful for many people, especially the ones with hearing impairments.

How To Create An SRT File?

Generally, you can create an SRT file in any text editor or by using SRT software.

Using Text Editor To Create An SRT File

To create an SRT file by using a text editor, you have to follow the below steps:

  1. Open any text editor, such as TextEdit or Notepad.
  2. Order your caption lines with a number beginning from 1.
  3. Click enter and put your timestamp. The format of the timestamp will be ‘hours:minutes:seconds,milliseconds --> hours:minutes:seconds,milliseconds’.
  4. Click enter again and start writing your caption.

Do make sure that you do not mess up the timestamp format.

Saving An SRT File From TextEdit on Mac

Open TextEdit on your Mac.

  1. Order your caption lines with a number beginning from 1.
  2. Click enter and put your timestamp. The format of the timestamp will be ‘hours:minutes:seconds,milliseconds --> hours:minutes:seconds,milliseconds’.
  3. Click enter again and start writing your caption.
  4. Go to Format and click on ‘Make Plain Text’.
  5. Go to File and click save.
  6. In the Save As text field, type down your file name. TextEdit will automatically put the file extension to .txt so you want to change it to .srt.
  7. Uncheck the ‘If no extension is provided, use .txt’ box and click save.

Using VideoTranslator To Create An SRT File

If you do not want to manually create an SRT file, you can use VideoTranslator. VideoTranslator uses AI to automatically transcribe your video. By using VideoTranslator, you can save a lot of time.

Here’s what you have to do to use VideoTranslator to create an SRT file:

  1. Go to www.videotranslator.ai
  2. If you already have an account, log in to your account. If you do not have an account, you can create an account or have a free trial.
  3. Upload your video using the quicktranscribe button.
  4. Select the language and dialect of the video and click the accept button to trigger the transcription. The transcription process will run in the background.
  5. Once the transcription is complete, go through and check the transcription for proper grammar e.g. capitalisation and full stops.
  6. Download the srt file.

How To Import SRT File To Adobe Premiere Pro

Now that you know how to create an SRT file, you are good to import your file to Adobe Premiere Pro.

Here is how you can import an SRT file in Adobe Premiere Pro:

  • Open your project in Adobe Premiere Pro. The Adobe Premiere Pro we use is the 2020 version.
  • Import the subtitle by clicking File > Import and find your subtitle file then click import.

Alternatively, you can drag your subtitle file to your timeline.

How To Edit Subtitle In Adobe Premiere Pro

There are two ways for you to edit your subtitle in Adobe Premiere Pro.

The First Way To Edit Subtitle In Adobe Premiere Pro

  1. Go to Window > Caption
  2. Click import settings. Here, you can preset the settings of your subtitles, such as font style, font size, and subtitle location.
  3. By doing this method, all of your subtitle settings will be unified.

The Second Way To Edit Subtitle In Adobe Premiere Pro

  1. Make sure that your SRT file is already available on your timeline.
  2. Double click on your subtitle file.
  3. The captions window will open. Here, you can individually edit each subtitle.

This method is good if you just want to edit some parts of your subtitle.

What Do I Do If My SRT File Does Not Show In Adobe Premiere Pro?

If you can’t see you SRT file in Adobe Premiere Pro, you may want to try the following:

  1. Click on the wrench icon on your timeline.
  2. Go to Closed Captions Display and make sure that it is enabled.

Exporting Video With Subtitle In Adobe Premiere Pro

To export a video with subtitle in Adobe Premiere Pro, you can do the following:

  • Click File > Export. Alternatively, you can type command + M.
  • Select your export setting format and preset.
  • Click export.

Your video will automatically have baked-in subtitle.

Conclusion

In this article, we have talked about what an SRT is, different ways to create an SRT file, how to import and edit SRT file to Adobe Premiere Pro and how to export video with subtitle in Adobe Premiere Pro.

Now that you are an expert, why don’t you try VideoTranslator to transcribe, translate and dub your video? Read how you can conveniently translate your video here.

For more information regarding VideoTranslator, do not hesitate to contact us at hello@videotranslator.ai.

See you next time for more educational blog posts!
